author: pepaee
content:
Hey guys, we'd like to start the discussion for a universal, enshrined encrypted mempool (EEM) EIP and would like to share an early draft with you guys, gathering feedback and input before sharing it with a wider audience next week!

There's a couple of key points about this:

- especially designed to fit into ePBS (and we think it sort of naturally aligns with ePBS very well)
- encryption technology agnostic (generalized encrypted mempool interface, open to multiple key providers, who could use e.g. TEE or t-FHE)
- adds the possibility of scheduling transactions into the future, with certain execution guarantees
- optionally, it also has the potential to fix what flashbot brought up as the "builder free option problem" in ePBS via an additional round of encryption.

Draft: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sWUmIq--0JtG1y-jgfiUkGxtLFfgjCgpMBow0UzlHxs/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.ov10okwbnbxr

Would be awesome to get your feedback on this, it's still in a relatively early state and we'd welcome all input!
